message: Piercing screams freeze me in place.
Shrieks, roars, explosions, gunshots.
I can't move amid the chaos.
The area is surrounded by lush forest, and also by bright red, lapping flames which give off thick, black smoke.
The sky is dark, but I can see as clearly as if it were day.
People are running about frantically. Some are trying to escape... and others are giving chase.
This... is Mink's past.
The still-bleeding wound Mink keeps hidden in his heart.
My heart suddenly skips a beat. My body feels like it's on fire.
It's so hot...
So hot...!
I force myself to look at my body. I'm not on fire. This is just like Rhyme, an illusion.
But the pain is so real! It's hard to breathe―my throat burns, and my lungs feel full of smoke.
This isn't real, I tell myself. It's no different from watching a recording.
I know that, but the pain is so strong. My body is drenched with sweat. It's all I can do to keep from puking.
As if to finish me off, the screams grow louder.
But I have to move.
I have to find Mink...
Wrapping my arms tight around my body to shield against the invisible flames, I slowly make my way forward.
This isn't real.
This all happened in the past.
I press on, repeating those words to myself, looking for Mink among the wailing and the dying.

...He's not there.
He's not anywhere.
Where is he?
